Note.Content: The meaning of בָתֵּי הַנֶּפֶשׁ is controversial: RSV NRSV NIV CEV "perfume" | NJB "scent" | NJPS "talismans" | REB "lockets" | GNT "magic charms". The commentary of Wildberger, who understand the expression as meaning "houses of souls" should still be considered the most adequate.

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it
literally: throat, but with focus on the air flowing through it; hence: = process by which air flows in and out of the body, which shows that a person or animal is alive

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passageways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non-physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= a living creature, including both humans and animals, as defined by the life principle that animates it
= a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= the dead body of a human being, ◄ as defined by the life principle that used to animate it; ≈ contact with it causes ritual uncleanness
conjectured meaning: = some kind of airy substance, a scent of some sort
